channel.description: Your pet’s favorite store, delivered to your door

item.title: About
item.dc:creator: pawsome
item.content:encoded:
Home

/

About us

Real care for real pets

We started our journey with one simple belief — that pets are family, and they deserve the same level of care, love, and quality as we do.

Our promise to pets and their people

A toy for dogs, a rope with knots for playing tug-of-war, it is suitable for active games with your pet. It is ideal for chewing on its own and for playing with the owner.

Every item in our store is selected with care, backed by knowledge, and delivered with love.

Real care for real pets

Fast delivery

We ship your pet’s favorites quickly, so you’re never out of treats or essentials.

Trusted ingredients

All our products are made with real, safe ingredients your pets will love — and you’ll trust.

Tailored selection

We handpick every item to suit real pets with real needs, from puppies to seniors.

Support that cares

Got a question? Our team is here to help with friendly advice and pet-parent tips.

I started this shop because I believe every pet deserves real food, gentle care, and a happy life - just like my own dog did.

Natalien Nigan - Founder of Pawsome

item.title: How to properly maintain hygiene
item.dc:creator: pawsome
item.content:encoded:
Feeding your dog isn’t just about filling a bowl with kibble — it’s about understanding what goes into that food, how it affects their health, and how to make the best choices based on their breed, age, activity level, and unique needs.

Why balanced nutrition matters

Proper nutrition plays a central role in your dog’s overall health, affecting everything from their coat quality to their digestion, mood, and immune system. Dogs, like humans, require a balance of macronutrients — proteins, fats, and carbohydrates — as well as essential vitamins and minerals.

The consequences of poor nutrition might not be immediately visible, but over time it can lead to chronic illnesses, poor energy levels, and decreased life expectancy. On the other hand, feeding your dog a balanced and appropriate diet helps them stay energetic, emotionally stable, and physically healthy.

Feeding your dog is more than just filling a bowl - it’s about fueling their life. Every meal is an opportunity to strengthen their health, boost their energy.

Dr. Anna L., Canine Nutritionist

Many pet owners unknowingly make mistakes by assuming all commercial foods are equal. However, not every product on the shelf meets the optimal standards of nutrition your dog deserves.

Key nutrients every dog needs

Protein is the most vital macronutrient for dogs. It supports muscle growth, repairs tissues, and is crucial for enzyme production. Fats, particularly Omega-3 and Omega-6 fatty acids, contribute to brain health, energy, and a shiny coat. Carbohydrates, though not essential, provide energy and aid digestion when sourced properly (like sweet potatoes or rice).

Beyond macronutrients, vitamins and minerals like Vitamin A, calcium, and zinc play important roles in bone development, vision, skin health, and metabolic function.

A lack of any of these nutrients can lead to issues such as brittle fur, digestive problems, or lethargy. Thus, choosing high-quality food rich in whole ingredients is crucial.

Home-cooked vs. commercial food

There’s a growing trend among dog owners to cook meals at home, aiming to give pets the same food-quality humans enjoy. While this seems noble, home-cooked meals often lack proper nutritional balance unless prepared under veterinary supervision.

Commercial dog food, on the other hand, especially when it's labeled as “complete and balanced” by AAFCO, is generally formulated to include all essential nutrients in the correct proportions. However, even here, not all brands are created equal — always read labels, avoid artificial preservatives, and prioritize transparency.

Important

If you’re considering switching to home-prepared food, consult with a veterinary nutritionist to avoid deficiencies.

How life stage affects dietary needs

Your dog’s age dramatically affects what they need nutritionally:

  • Puppies: need food high in calories and protein to support growth and development.
  • Adult: require maintenance diets that keep them active without leading to weight gain.
  • Senior: may benefit from lower-calorie food with joint support supplements like glucosamine.

Breed size also plays a part: large breeds often require slower-growth formulas as puppies, while small breeds benefit from higher calorie density due to their fast metabolisms.

Breed size also plays a part: large breeds often require slower-growth formulas as puppies, while small breeds benefit from higher calorie density due to their fast metabolisms.

Signs of poor nutrition in dogs

Sometimes, it’s not obvious your dog isn’t getting the nutrition they need. But some subtle signs can include:

  1. Dull or thinning coat
  2. Lack of energy or interest in play
  3. Loose stool or constipation
  4. Excessive shedding or itching
  5. Bad breath

If you observe one or more of these signs, it may be time to reassess your dog’s diet. Regular veterinary check-ups are also important in catching these issues early.

Conclusion: Nourish with care

Your dog depends on you to make the best choices for their health. Nutrition isn't a one-size-fits-all approach — it evolves as your dog grows and changes. By staying informed, reading labels, and being mindful of your dog’s unique needs, you’re giving them the best chance at a long, joyful, tail-wagging life.

The consequences of poor nutrition might not be immediately visible, but over time it can lead to chronic illnesses, poor energy levels, and decreased life expectancy. On the other hand, feeding your dog a balanced and appropriate diet helps them stay energetic, emotionally stable, and physically healthy.

Feeding your dog is more than just filling a bowl - it’s about fueling their life. Every meal is an opportunity to strengthen their health, boost their energy.

Dr. Anna L., Canine Nutritionist

Many pet owners unknowingly make mistakes by assuming all commercial foods are equal. However, not every product on the shelf meets the optimal standards of nutrition your dog deserves.

Key nutrients every dog needs

Protein is the most vital macronutrient for dogs. It supports muscle growth, repairs tissues, and is crucial for enzyme production. Fats, particularly Omega-3 and Omega-6 fatty acids, contribute to brain health, energy, and a shiny coat. Carbohydrates, though not essential, provide energy and aid digestion when sourced properly (like sweet potatoes or rice).

Beyond macronutrients, vitamins and minerals like Vitamin A, calcium, and zinc play important roles in bone development, vision, skin health, and metabolic function.

A lack of any of these nutrients can lead to issues such as brittle fur, digestive problems, or lethargy. Thus, choosing high-quality food rich in whole ingredients is crucial.

Home-cooked vs. commercial food

There’s a growing trend among dog owners to cook meals at home, aiming to give pets the same food-quality humans enjoy. While this seems noble, home-cooked meals often lack proper nutritional balance unless prepared under veterinary supervision.

Commercial dog food, on the other hand, especially when it's labeled as “complete and balanced” by AAFCO, is generally formulated to include all essential nutrients in the correct proportions. However, even here, not all brands are created equal — always read labels, avoid artificial preservatives, and prioritize transparency.

Important

If you’re considering switching to home-prepared food, consult with a veterinary nutritionist to avoid deficiencies.

How life stage affects dietary needs

Your dog’s age dramatically affects what they need nutritionally:

  • Puppies: need food high in calories and protein to support growth and development.
  • Adult: require maintenance diets that keep them active without leading to weight gain.
  • Senior: may benefit from lower-calorie food with joint support supplements like glucosamine.

Breed size also plays a part: large breeds often require slower-growth formulas as puppies, while small breeds benefit from higher calorie density due to their fast metabolisms.

Breed size also plays a part: large breeds often require slower-growth formulas as puppies, while small breeds benefit from higher calorie density due to their fast metabolisms.

Signs of poor nutrition in dogs

Sometimes, it’s not obvious your dog isn’t getting the nutrition they need. But some subtle signs can include:

  1. Dull or thinning coat
  2. Lack of energy or interest in play
  3. Loose stool or constipation
  4. Excessive shedding or itching
  5. Bad breath

If you observe one or more of these signs, it may be time to reassess your dog’s diet. Regular veterinary check-ups are also important in catching these issues early.

There’s a growing trend among dog owners to cook meals at home, aiming to give pets the same food-quality humans enjoy. While this seems noble, home-cooked meals often lack proper nutritional balance unless prepared under veterinary supervision.

Commercial dog food, on the other hand, especially when it's labeled as “complete and balanced” by AAFCO, is generally formulated to include all essential nutrients in the correct proportions. How life stage affects dietary needs

Your dog’s age dramatically affects what they need nutritionally:

  • Puppies: need food high in calories and protein to support growth and development.
  • Adult: require maintenance diets that keep them active without leading to weight gain.
  • Senior: may benefit from lower-calorie food with joint support supplements like glucosamine.

Breed size also plays a part: large breeds often require slower-growth formulas as puppies, while small breeds benefit from higher calorie density due to their fast metabolisms.

If you observe one or more of these signs, it may be time to reassess your dog’s diet. Regular veterinary check-ups are also important in catching these issues early.

item.title: Refund and Returns Policy
item.dc:creator: pawsome
item.content:encoded:
This is a sample page.

Overview

Our refund and returns policy lasts 30 days. If 30 days have passed since your purchase, we can’t offer you a full refund or exchange.

To be eligible for a return, your item must be unused and in the same condition that you received it. It must also be in the original packaging.

Several types of goods are exempt from being returned. Perishable goods such as food, flowers, newspapers or magazines cannot be returned. We also do not accept products that are intimate or sanitary goods, hazardous materials, or flammable liquids or gases.

Additional non-returnable items:

  • Gift cards
  • Downloadable software products
  • Some health and personal care items

To complete your return, we require a receipt or proof of purchase.

Please do not send your purchase back to the manufacturer.

There are certain situations where only partial refunds are granted:

  • Book with obvious signs of use
  • CD, DVD, VHS tape, software, video game, cassette tape, or vinyl record that has been opened.
  • Any item not in its original condition, is damaged or missing parts for reasons not due to our error.
  • Any item that is returned more than 30 days after delivery

Refunds

Once your return is received and inspected, we will send you an email to notify you that we have received your returned item. We will also notify you of the approval or rejection of your refund.

If you are approved, then your refund will be processed, and a credit will automatically be applied to your credit card or original method of payment, within a certain amount of days.

Late or missing refunds

If you haven’t received a refund yet, first check your bank account again.

Then contact your credit card company, it may take some time before your refund is officially posted.

Next contact your bank. There is often some processing time before a refund is posted.

If you’ve done all of this and you still have not received your refund yet, please contact us at {email address}.

Sale items

Only regular priced items may be refunded. Sale items cannot be refunded.

Exchanges

We only replace items if they are defective or damaged. If you need to exchange it for the same item, send us an email at {email address} and send your item to: {physical address}.

Gifts

If the item was marked as a gift when purchased and shipped directly to you, you’ll receive a gift credit for the value of your return. Once the returned item is received, a gift certificate will be mailed to you.

If the item wasn’t marked as a gift when purchased, or the gift giver had the order shipped to themselves to give to you later, we will send a refund to the gift giver and they will find out about your return.

Shipping returns

To return your product, you should mail your product to: {physical address}.

You will be responsible for paying for your own shipping costs for returning your item. Shipping costs are non-refundable. If you receive a refund, the cost of return shipping will be deducted from your refund.

Depending on where you live, the time it may take for your exchanged product to reach you may vary.

If you are returning more expensive items, you may consider using a trackable shipping service or purchasing shipping insurance. We don’t guarantee that we will receive your returned item.

Need help?

Contact us at {email} for questions related to refunds and returns.

item.title: Treats biscuits
item.dc:creator: pawsome
item.content:encoded: Crunchy, oven-baked biscuit treats made with tasty and wholesome ingredients for a delightful snacking experience. Perfect for training, rewarding good behavior, or bonding moments. Their crunchy texture supports dental health. A delicious treat dogs look forward to every day.
item.excerpt:encoded: Crunchy, oven-baked biscuit treats made with tasty, wholesome ingredients—perfect for rewarding good behavior and adding a little joy to every day.

item.title: Bone treats for senior cats
item.dc:creator: pawsome
item.content:encoded:
This collagen face cream is designed to deeply moisturize the skin while supporting its natural firmness and elasticity. The rich yet non-greasy texture absorbs smoothly, helping to reduce the appearance of fine lines, restore bounce, and keep the skin soft and supple throughout the day.
Infused with collagen-boosting ingredients and hydrating agents, it strengthens the skin barrier, improves texture, and protects against dryness and signs of aging. With consistent use, the skin looks firmer, more lifted, and visibly rejuvenated. Suitable for normal, dry, and mature skin types, this cream is free from parabens, mineral oils, artificial fragrance, and harsh chemicals. Apply evenly on face and neck as the final step in your skincare routine, morning and night, for youthful, well-hydrated skin.
item.excerpt:encoded: Soft yet crunchy bone-shaped treats specially made for senior cats, with easy-to-digest ingredients to support joint health, vitality, and gentle daily nutrition.

item.title: Dog multy-meats food
item.dc:creator: pawsome
item.content:encoded: A rich blend of carefully selected meat proteins that supports strength, stamina, and high energy levels. This complete and balanced formula provides essential nutrients for muscle health and immunity. Designed to keep dogs active, strong, and satisfied. Ideal for energetic and healthy dogs of all breeds.
item.excerpt:encoded: Premium multi-meat dog food made with a rich blend of proteins to support strong muscles, high energy, and overall health—complete, balanced nutrition for happy, active dogs.

item.title: Food for puppies
item.dc:creator: pawsome
item.content:encoded: Complete nutrition designed for growing puppies to support strong bones, brain development, and healthy muscles. Enriched with protein, DHA, and essential vitamins. Fuels early growth and playful energy.
item.excerpt:encoded: Complete puppy food made with high-quality protein, DHA, vitamins, and minerals to support healthy growth, strong bones, brain development, and playful energy in every stage of early life.

item.title: Cat ball for daily playing
item.dc:creator: pawsome
item.content:encoded:
This Cat Ball Toy is the perfect everyday play companion for energetic felines. Crafted from lightweight, durable materials, it rolls easily and unpredictably to spark your cat’s natural hunting instincts. Ideal for batting, chasing, and pouncing, it provides essential physical activity while reducing boredom and supporting mental stimulation.
Safe for indoor daily use, this toy keeps your cat entertained whether playing alone or with you. Great for kittens and adult cats alike, the Cat Ball Toy delivers simple, long-lasting fun.
item.excerpt:encoded: Lightweight, engaging cat ball toy designed for daily play. Encourages chasing, batting, and exercise to keep cats active and entertained.

item.title: Bone diet treats
item.dc:creator: pawsome
item.content:encoded: A rich blenLow-calorie, bone-shaped diet treats created for weight-conscious pets without compromising on taste. Their satisfying crunchy texture supports natural chewing behavior. Made with light, wholesome ingredients for better digestion and metabolism. Perfect for guilt-free daily rewards and training.d of carefully selected meat proteins that supports strength, stamina, and high energy levels. This complete and balanced formula provides essential nutrients for muscle health and immunity. Designed to keep dogs active, strong, and satisfied. Ideal for energetic and healthy dogs of all breeds.
item.excerpt:encoded: Low-calorie bone-shaped diet treats made with wholesome ingredients to support weight control while still satisfying your pet’s urge to chew—healthy, crunchy, and guilt-free

item.title: Ball for dogs
item.dc:creator: pawsome
item.content:encoded:
This Dog Ball Toy is a classic playtime essential built for endless fun. Made from durable, pet-safe materials, it delivers an exciting bounce that keeps dogs chasing, fetching, and running. Perfect for outdoor adventures or indoor play, the ball encourages healthy exercise while satisfying your dog’s natural instincts to chase and retrieve.
Its tough design withstands daily chewing and active play, making it a reliable choice for dogs of all sizes. Lightweight, easy to clean, and great for bonding sessions, this ball ensures hours of active entertainment every day.
item.excerpt:encoded: Durable dog ball designed for fetch, chewing, and daily play. Bounces well, encourages exercise, and keeps dogs active and engaged.

item.title: Cat dry food
item.dc:creator: pawsome
item.content:encoded: Crunchy and balanced nutrition crafted for everyday feeding, made with quality protein to support strong muscles and steady energy levels. It helps maintain a shiny coat, healthy skin, and smooth digestion. Enriched with essential vitamins and minerals, it supports overall wellness. A complete daily meal for active and happy cats
item.excerpt:encoded: Crunchy, balanced dry cat food made with high-quality protein to support healthy muscles, shiny coat, and daily energy—delicious nutrition cats love in every bite

item.title: Soft rope toy for dogs
item.dc:creator: pawsome
item.content:encoded:
This rope toy for dogs is a versatile option for active play, chewing and training. Made of durable natural fibers, it can withstand even the most vigorous tugging and helps maintain healthy teeth and gums.
It is ideal for chewing on its own and for playing with the owner. This toy is not only entertaining, but also reduces stress and boredom in your pet.
item.excerpt:encoded: A toy for dogs, a rope with knots for playing tug-of-war, it is suitable for active games with your pet. It is ideal for chewing on its own and for playing with the owner.

item.title: Multy-rope toy for dogs
item.dc:creator: pawsome
item.content:encoded:
The Multi-Rope Dog Toy is a tough, engaging playtime essential built to satisfy your dog’s natural instincts to chew, tug, and fetch. Constructed from tightly woven, high-quality cotton rope, this toy features multiple knots and strands that provide added durability and grip during active play. The varying rope textures help gently clean your dog’s teeth and gums, supporting better dental health with every chew.
Perfect for solo chewing or interactive games like tug-of-war, this toy encourages physical exercise, reduces boredom, and strengthens the bond between you and your pup. Suitable for dogs of all sizes, the Multi-Rope Dog Toy offers safe, long-lasting fun at home, outdoors, or on the go.
item.excerpt:encoded: Durable multi-rope dog toy designed for tugging, chewing, and interactive play. Made with strong, knotted cotton ropes to support dental health and keep dogs entertained.

item.title: Dry food with chicken & beef
item.dc:creator: pawsome
item.content:encoded:
Our Dry Food with Chicken & Beef is a complete and balanced meal crafted to support your pet’s daily health and vitality. Made with high-quality chicken and beef as primary protein sources, it helps maintain strong muscles while delivering great taste pets love.

The crunchy kibble supports dental health, while essential vitamins, minerals, and nutrients promote healthy digestion, shiny coat, and overall well-being. Ideal for daily feeding, this formula provides the energy and nourishment your pet needs to stay active and happy.
item.excerpt:encoded: Premium dry food made with real chicken and beef for balanced, everyday nutrition.

item.title: Daily food set for adult dogs
item.dc:creator: pawsome
item.content:encoded:
The Daily Food Set for Adult Dogs provides balanced, complete nutrition to support your dog’s health, energy, and overall well-being. Carefully formulated with quality ingredients, it delivers the right blend of proteins, fats, vitamins, and minerals needed for adult dogs to maintain strong muscles, healthy digestion, and an active lifestyle.

Ideal for everyday feeding, this food set helps keep your dog satisfied, energetic, and healthy day after day.
item.excerpt:encoded: Complete daily food set specially formulated to meet the nutritional needs of adult dogs.
